newsitem.title: CHINA: China to inaugurate new ceremonial cannon for HK.
newsitem.headline: China to inaugurate new ceremonial cannon for HK.

text.p: Heads of state who visit China after the Hong Kong handover on July 1 will be greeted by a ceremonial salute from sleeker, louder cannon inaugurated to celebrate the recovery of the British colony.
The new "97" cannon -- marking China's July 1, 1997 resumption of sovereignty over Hong Kong -- replace the previous "86" cannon in use for a decade, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
The 97 generation of cannon that will fire the ceremonial salute for visiting heads of state is more sleekly designed and has a rich thundering sound that can be heard from far away, Xinhua said.
